definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: High brown boots with laces dangling.
sentences.chinese: 棕色长统靴，饰带晃来晃去。

sentences.english: Mechlin lace was arranged in a cascade down the front of the bodice.
sentences.chinese: 梅希林花边的饰带如瀑布般层叠在紧身胸衣上。

sentences.english: Hidden under the straw was a little pile of lump sugar and several bunches of ribbon of different colours.
sentences.chinese: 草下竟藏着一堆方糖和几条不同颜色的饰带。

sentences.english: Amber satin and white lace are exactly what she desires.
sentences.chinese: 琥珀色的缎子和白色的饰带正是她所想要的。

sentences.english: They’ve made the presidential sash for the last five presidents.
sentences.chinese: 他们一家已经为五位总统做总统饰带了。

sentences.english: A low-cut sports shoe with fringed laces.
sentences.chinese: 有流苏饰带的低帮运动鞋。

sentences.english: His uniform is laced with gold.
sentences.chinese: 他的制服上镶有金色饰带。

sentences.english: We want to buy Ribbons and Laces, A Variety of Ribbons With Affordable Price.
sentences.chinese: 我们要采购缎带和饰带，用可负担的价格多种缎带。

definition: a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
